title: HPC Modular Education: Master’s Course on GPU-Based Parallel Programming and Social Collaboration System Design

context.prior_knowledge: Mid-level professional knowledge and problem-solving skills, foundational understanding of social infrastructure systems, and data-driven decision-making experience
context.additional_context: A graduate-level HPC (High-Performance Computing) expert training program offering flexible time management through MOOC-based modular learning. It emphasizes hands-on education using BYOD, project-based assessments for practical skills, and computing solutions for societal issues like climate change and urban planning.

learning_goals: Learners can implement GPU-accelerated code using OpenACC, OpenMP Offloading, and HIP programming models and optimize the performance of collaborative systems in heterogeneous computing environments.

Learners can understand heterogeneous computing, cultivate the ability to design CPU-GPU collaborative systems, and develop technologies applicable to large-scale social infrastructure projects (e.g., smart cities, energy grids).

Learners can complete a large-scale data parallel processing project in an HPC environment and develop solutions applicable to real-world industrial fields (e.g., healthcare, transportation, environmental problem-solving).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
